definitions.definition: the job of being president of a country or an organization; the period of time somebody holds this job

examples.text: the current holder of the EU presidency
She hopes to be the first woman elected to the presidency of the United States.
He was a White House official during the Biden presidency.
She held the presidency of the association for three years.
He became a candidate for the presidency.
That year he resigned his presidency of the Academy.
Three years into his presidency, he is more popular than ever.
under the presidency of Barack Obama

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from medieval Latin praesidentia, from praesidere ‘sit before’, from prae ‘before’ + sedere ‘sit’.
